Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with three bands in faded added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (back, underbelly, haunch and start of mane remaining) to right; pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The lack of decoration on the interior suggests that the sherd should be placed within the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0248) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
